title: Drawing, "Spandrel Design:  Truth and Fame Applauding Louis XV", 1753
medium: Black chalk, pen and brown ink,  brush and pale pink wash on white paper, lined
signed: Signed in pen and brown ink, lower left corner: F. Boucher / 1753.
provenance:
Léon Decloux (acquired after 1906).

Ex-coll. Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 18, for 135 francs) (ref. H. Mireur, Dictionnaire des Ventes d'Art, Paris, 1911, Vol.1, p. 400)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A putto, companion of Fame, directs the attention of Truth to a portrait of Louis XV.  The women are seated in the foreground above a pedestal before which stands an incense burner.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Spandrel Design:  Truth and Fame Applauding Louis XV", 1753.
1753. Black chalk, pen and brown ink,  brush and pale pink wash on white paper, lined. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-8.
